subject: Issue with order #SSN4515
description_text:
Good afternoon,
Today I received my new Simsonn pedals as part of the above order #, but
the baseplate is missing from the order, and the haptic motors are still
not here as it looks like they never left China.

When can I expect the haptic motors as I paid for expedited shipping, and
what can be done about the missing baseplate? I look forward to your answer
as I have been looking forward to these new pedals.

Thank you,
Morgan Anderson

conversations.body_text: Hi Morgan,     We sincerely apologize for the delays caused by the shortage of floor stock in our U.S. warehouse. Our inventory has now been replenished, and we have arranged for your shipment. Here is your new tracking number: 1ZJ201H40334526817  Vam Pro: https://t.17track.net/en#nums=JSELO0810892729YQ

Hello,
I have received all of the parts and have set them up. My brake pedal is
not registering in the Simsonn software. I have run Firmware updates, tried
checking different ports on the Simsonn hub & on my computer, nothing is
seeming to work. Please help as I want to be able to use my pedals.

On Mon, Dec 15, 2025, 4:55 AM service@simsonn.com

Good afternoon,
More issues are arriving since this order.

- the haptic motors are still not here.
- the brake pedal is still experiencing issues, specifically with the small
wire that connects it to the Simsonn hub. It is almost like it tried to
come apart at one point.
- after one day of use, the pedals now will not be ready by any sim racing
game, and are having issues inside the Simsonn app. They will randomly stop
sending a signal when being tested every 3-4 seconds, and will not
calibrate properly.
Hello Simsonn,  I am still having issues with the brake pedal I ordered. It is no longer registering at all with the computer.

Hi Morgan,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding  ​   Please make sure the pedal’s USB is directly connected to the rear USB 3.0 (blue) port of your computer. Do not use a USB hub.  If the issue persists, please follow these steps:    Press and hold the upgrade button on the control box;    Connect the USB cable — at this point, SIMSONN Manager 2.1.2 will show that the device has entered SIMSONN Flasher Mode;    Go to Settings → Update → Manual Update Firmware → pedals → firmware → pedals-plusx.sfu;    After the update is complete, please test the device again.     If you adjust the brake damping, you need to click Offset to zero the pedal’s white signal to the 0% position.

Hello,
The steps provided did not rectify the issue. The throttle pedal is working
just fine, the brake is not registering at all.

On Sun, Dec 28, 2025, 10:06 AM service@simsonn.com
Hi Morgan,  Please click Offset, take a photo of the pop-up window and send it to me. Then follow the procedure to zero the pedal signal and recalibrate to see if it resolves the brake issue.
